@Annarosehunter @dnd_retweets When I was 18 & in the service, we had parties every Friday night at the local Holiday Inn off base. #DnD DMs: What's your favorite motif? The one you keep returning to?
Mine is doors. Doors can be anything, take your PCs literally anywhere; liminal spaces that offer transitions b/t one world & another, past & present, history & memory. My stories always feature magical doors. https://t.co/qFNihDe42U
@StevenTDennis https://t.co/8EyXAlKgrC

@TheGodDamnDM I used to stress out & try to BS, but now when I am truly flummoxed I have a few tricks:
1. End session early: "You stumped me, guys. I need to think about it."
2. Random encounter!: "Uhh...look out, a bugbear!"
3. Ask them what should happen: "So what happens next, folks?"
This is the year that I figured out that I could just ask for dice and books and dice and minis and dice and more books for Christmas. Why didn't I think of this before?? #DnD

@hishgraphics @Hjorimir @phyrce @D_n_D_n_D @Sunglar Yes, if I were to implement RPG play as curriculum, it would have to be paired w/metacognitive review: students would have to blog or journal about their experiences not just in game, but also in problem-solving issues that arise: rules interpretation, player conflicts, etc.

@hishgraphics @phyrce @Hjorimir @D_n_D_n_D @Sunglar WestEd teaches a six-week online course for teaching literacy to adults. I took it, and it helped give me a framework for teaching reading: https://t.co/BELTqCS7gu

@hishgraphics @phyrce @Hjorimir @D_n_D_n_D @Sunglar #DnD can address all four dimensions of the Reading Apprenticeship Framework's metacognitive conversation when teaching adults to read: the social, personal, cognitive, and knowledge-building. https://t.co/37i24w6xsw
@Hjorimir That's a monk.
@phyrce @Hjorimir @D_n_D_n_D @Sunglar @hishgraphics teaches English to adults using RPGs. It's an intriguing idea.

@SlyFlourish This adventure, fragments of a demon's telepathic interrogation of an NPC crashed into the PCs' telepathic bond when they entered its lair. This revealed a major campaign secret the NPC had kept from the group. #DnD
